channel.title: Posts on Chapel Language Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Chapel Language Blog

item.title: Welcome to the Chapel blog!
item.description: An introduction to the Chapel blog, and our intentions and plans for it.

item.title: Navier-Stokes in Chapel — Distributed Cavity-Flow Solver
item.description: Writing a distributed and parallel Navier-Stokes solver in Chapel, with an MPI performance comparison

item.title: Doing science in Python? Wishing for more speed or scalability?
item.description: A call for computational science collaborations around Chapel and Python

item.title: Reflections on ChapelCon '24: A Community Growing Together
item.description: This post is a retrospective on ChapelCon ‘24

item.title: Chapel 2.0: Scalable and Productive Computing for All
item.description: This post announces Chapel 2.0, including a brief tour of what the language is capable of.

item.title: Introduction to GPU Programming in Chapel
item.description: This post gives a beginner’s introduction to Chapel’s GPU programming features

item.title: Parallel Processing of a Billion Rows of Data in Chapel
item.description: A Chapel Implementation of the One Billion Row Challenge

item.title: Announcing Chapel 2.4!
item.description: Highlights from the March 2025 release of Chapel 2.4

item.title: Announcing Chapel 2.3!
item.description: Highlights from the December 2024 release of Chapel 2.3

item.title: Announcing Chapel 2.2!
item.description: A summary of highlights from the September 2024 release of Chapel 2.2

item.title: Announcing Chapel 2.1!
item.description: A summary of highlights from the June 2024 release of Chapel 2.1

item.title: Announcing Chapel 1.33!
item.description: A summary of highlights from the December 2023 release of Chapel 1.33.0

item.title: Advent of Code 2022: Twelve Days of Chapel
item.description: The Chapel team’s plan for blogging during Advent of Code 2022.

item.title: 10 Myths About Scalable Parallel Programming Languages (Redux), Part 1: Productivity and Performance
item.description: An archival post from the IEEE TCSC blog in 2012 with a modern reflection on it

item.title: Chapel/Fortran Interop in an Ocean Model: Introduction
item.description: An introduction to interoperating between Chapel and Fortran

item.title: Memory Safety in Chapel
item.description: A description of how Chapel’s features for memory safety strike a balance between productivity and performance, with comparisons to other languages

item.title: Announcing ChapelCon '25!
item.description: Announcing our plans for ChapelCon ‘25

item.title: Chapel's Runtime Types as an Interesting Alternative to Dependent Types
item.description: A comparison of Chapel’s runtime types with other languages’ type systems

item.title: 7 Questions for Bill Reus: Interactive Supercomputing with Chapel for Cybersecurity
item.description: An interview with Bill Reus about the creation of Arkouda, a Python library supporting interactive data analysis on HPC systems

item.title: Using the Chapel Compiler to Develop Language Tooling
item.description: A demonstration of using Chapel’s compiler library to develop custom language tooling

item.title: SC24 from the Chapel Language Perspective
item.description: A summary of highlights at SC24 relating to Chapel and Arkouda

item.title: 7 Questions for David Bader: Graph Analytics at Scale with Arkouda and Chapel
item.description: An interview with Computer Science Professor David Bader about his use of Arkouda for graph analytics

item.title: Navier-Stokes in Chapel — Distributed Poisson Solver
item.description: Introduction to Chapel’s distributed programming concepts used in Navier-Stokes Simulation

item.title: 7 Questions for Nelson Luís Dias: Atmospheric Turbulence in Chapel
item.description: An interview with Professor of Environmental Engineering Nelson Luís Dias about his use of Chapel in analyzing Atmospheric Turbulence

item.title: Distributed Tuning in Chapel with a Hyperparameter Optimization Example
item.description: This post shows how to write a distributed tuning program in Chapel

item.title: 7 Questions for Scott Bachman: Analyzing Coral Reefs with Chapel
item.description: An interview with oceanographer Scott Bachman, focusing on his work to measure coral reef biodiversity using satellite image analysis

item.title: 7 Questions for Éric Laurendeau: Computing Aircraft Aerodynamics in Chapel
item.description: An interview with CHAMPS PI and Professor of Mechanical Engineering, Éric Laurendeau

item.title: What’s New with Chapel? Nine Questions for the Development Team
item.description: An interview published by HPCWire with Brad Chamberlain

item.title: Measure the Performance of your Gaming GPU with Chapel
item.description: This post demonstrates using the Windows Subsystem for Linux to run Chapel code on a GPU from NVIDIA

item.title: Navier-Stokes in Chapel — 2D Simulations and Performance
item.description: An exploration of Chapel’s scientific computing capabilities using the CFD Python Tutorial and a C++/OpenMP performance comparison

item.title: Generic Linear Multistep Method Evaluator using Chapel
item.description: In this article, we use advanced features of the Chapel type system to implement a general linear multistep method evaluator for approximating differential equations.

item.title: Chapel's High-Level Support for CPU-GPU Data Transfers and Multi-GPU Programming
item.description: This post covers how Chapel’s arrays, parallelism, and locality features enable moving data between CPUs and GPUs.

item.title: Navier-Stokes in Chapel — Introduction
item.description: A starting point for applying Chapel to scientific computing problems using the CFD Python tutorial.

item.title: Supercharged Chapel Editor Support
item.description: An introduction to new editor features supported by Chapel.

item.title: Introducing ChapelCon '24: The Chapel Event of the Year
item.description: This post discusses why we rebranded CHIUW to ChapelCon and what to expect from it.

item.title: Changes to Chapel 2.0 Since its First Release Candidate
item.description: A summary of breaking and other notable additions made since Chapel 1.32

item.title: Comparing Standard Library Sorts: The Impact of Parallelism
item.description: This blog post compares the performance of standard library sort routines in several programming languages.

item.title: SC23 from the Chapel Language Perspective
item.description: A summary of highlights at SC23 relating to Chapel and Arkouda

item.title: Help us prioritize features for future releases of Chapel
item.description: A call for input on feature prioritization published on the HPE Developer Blog

item.title: Programming with Chapel: Making the Power of Parallelism and Supercomputers More Accessible
item.description: An interview published by the devm.io blog with Brad Chamberlain

item.title: My Favorite C++ Pattern: X Macros
item.description: A survey of the use of X macros in Chapel’s compiler

item.title: Announcing Chapel 1.32!
item.description: A summary of highlights from the September 2023 release of Chapel 1.32.0

item.title: Announcing Chapel 1.31!
item.description: A summary of highlights from the June 2023 release of Chapel 1.31.0

item.title: Proving My Compiler Code Incorrect With Alloy
item.description: A team member’s experience applying model checking to the Chapel compiler

item.title: NetCDF in Chapel, Part 2: Reading a Dataset in Parallel
item.description: Exploring distributed file IO in Chapel using distributed domains, arrays, and hyperslabs while handling unknown dataset shapes

item.title: NetCDF in Chapel, Part 1: Interfacing with the C Library
item.description: An introduction to C interoperability in Chapel using the NetCDF library

item.title: Announcing Chapel 1.30.0!
item.description: A summary of highlights from the March 2023 release of Chapel 1.30.0

item.title: Advent of Code 2022: Wrap-up
item.description: A summary of our twelve days of AoC 2022 and a peek at some of Chapel’s distributed programming features

item.title: Advent of Code 2022, Day 12: On the Summit
item.description: A solution to day twelve of AoC 2022, covering atomic variables and recursive task parallelism

item.title: Advent of Code 2022, Day 11: Monkeying Around
item.description: A parallel solution to day eleven of AoC 2022, using Chapel’s task parallel features.

item.title: Announcing Chapel 1.29.0!
item.description: A summary of highlights from the December 2022 release of Chapel 1.29.0

item.title: Advent of Code 2022, Day 10: Scan Lines
item.description: A solution to day ten of AoC 2022, introducing scan expressions.

item.title: Advent of Code 2022, Day 9: Elvish String Theory
item.description: A solution to day nine of AoC 2022, covering select-statements, arrays, and math functions

item.title: Advent of Code 2022, Day 8: Hiding Treehouses
item.description: A solution to day eight of AoC 2022, introducing domains and multidimensional arrays.

item.title: Advent of Code 2022, Day 7: Traversing Directories
item.description: A solution to day seven of AoC 2022, introducing classes and memory management.

item.title: Advent of Code 2022, Day 6: Packet Detection
item.description: A parallel solution to day six of AoC 2022, introducing configs, parallel loop expressions, range translation, and named, unbounded, and counted ranges.

item.title: Advent of Code 2022, Day 5: Stacking Crates
item.description: A solution to day five of AoC 2022 featuring arrays, lists, strided ranges, zippered iteration, unbounded ranges, and references.

item.title: Advent of Code 2022, Day 4: Finding Overlaps in Cleanup Ranges
item.description: A couple of succinct solutions to day four of AoC 2022. Learn about formatted IO, ranges, and parallel reductions in Chapel as well as some general problem-solving approaches.

item.title: Advent of Code 2022, Day 3: Rucksack Comparisons
item.description: A parallel solution to day three of AoC 2022, introducing ranges, bytes, forall-loops, and sets

item.title: Advent of Code 2022, Day 2: Rochambeau
item.description: A parallel solution to day two of AoC 2022, introducing enums, procedures, iterators, arrays, and promotion

item.title: Advent of Code 2022, Day 1: Counting Calories
item.description: A simple solution to day one of AoC 2022, introducing basic Chapel concepts
